author: spacemonkeyforta
content: Hi <@550420431744794624>! My team at Forta Network, along with OpenZeppelin, have developed a new precompile we are considering submitting as an RIP. Is there a separate RIP submission and review process independent from the EIP process documented at https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1?

author: abcoathup
content:
"The RIPs repository is in the startup phase, and so is undergoing many changes. This document is very much a work in progress. Both the process and how RIPs will be written and governed is still being worked on. Feedback encouraged on Ethereum Magicians."  
From RIP7559:
https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/blob/e0ce6e9614d5bf152df9f34aee361b2456b3c752/RIPS/rip-7559.md

author: spacemonkeyforta
content: Thanks for sharing <@365300888354422794>. Since RIPs are optional, is this RIP process then intended to largely be a *shared* forum and public comment period for new features being considered by one or more rollups? I'm assuming any proposed feature would need to go through the governance process for each rollup after it goes through the RIP process.
